ACTED, Convergences and its partners : the Committee of the Tourism Development under the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan, the European Bank for Reconstruction & Development, the International Finance Corporation and Asia+, within the SwitchAsia Programme were happy to welcome the very first Zero Carbon Forum on May 28th, 2022. This event was a chance to meet the professionals working towards a sustainable consumption and production in the sector of tourism and beyond!

Co-constructed with members of the Working Group composed of experts in the tourism and energy sectors in Tajikistan, the Zero Carbon Forum aimed to be a platform for dialogue and networking where key issues are discussed and where projects supporting the dissemination of sustainable consumption and production practices to build a Zero Carbon Tajikistan are collaboratively created, encouraged and valorised.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”section” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”46px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

ZERO CARBON FORUM

PROGRAMME

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ background_color=”#0a0a2d” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”center” module_alignment=”center” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

WORKSHOPS STRUCTURE

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Interactive round tables for the sharing and dissemination of good practices
  • Workshops for consultation and development of deliverable (maps, roadmaps, barometer etc.)
  • Fair & exhibition : showcase of RE/EE technologies, CBT products and expertise and showcasing MFI green products opportunities

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ background_color=”#0a0a2d” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”center” module_alignment=”center” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

MAIN WORKSHOPS PURPOSE

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Foster transition to reaching net-zero carbon emissions in Tajikistan
  • Create a space for dialogue for the sustainable production and consumption development
  • Promote market linkages between the renewable energy, energy efficiency sector and community-based tourism sector as well as financial institutions and general public

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ background_color=”#0a0a2d” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”center” module_alignment=”center” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

 SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Reflecting on the state of things, plans and best practices in regard to sustainable consumption and production, circular economy and green energy in Tajikistan by bringing together Government institution, international development agencies, donors and investors, the private sector and the civil community about the country’s transition to a green economy and sustainable development

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”46px” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]

PARTNERS AND SUPPORT

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”justified” hover_enabled=”0″ use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″]

To organise this forum, ACTED, Convergences have been supported by its partners: the Committee of Tourism Development, the European Bank for Reconstruction & Development, the International Finance Corporation and Asia+, Tajnor and Amfot within the EU SwitchAsia Programme.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ text_font_size=”25″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”center” module_alignment=”center” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

MAIN PARTNERS
